title: Venezuela Live Updates: U.S. Forces Seize Two Tankers; Rubio Lays Out Plan for American Control
summary: After the secretary of state unveiled a proposal for managing Venezuela and the U.S. forces boarded a Russian-flagged tanker and a second ship, President Trump had a phone call with President Gustavo Petro of Colombia amid escalating tensions between the two leaders.

title: During Maduro Raid in Venezuela, a Close Call for Helicopters and Trump’s Plan
summary: As a damaged U.S. helicopter struggled to stay aloft over Venezuela’s capital, the success of the entire operation hung in the balance.

title: Maduro Is Gone, but Repression in Venezuela Has Intensified
summary: Security forces have boarded buses, searched phones and interrogated people, looking for evidence that they welcomed the capture of Nicolás Maduro.

title: Oil Firms Say Venezuela Owes Them Billions Over Earlier Investments
summary: Companies like Exxon Mobil and ConocoPhillips say that Venezuela owes them billions of dollars for confiscating their assets two decades ago.

title: Lawmakers Split After Classified Briefings on Venezuela
summary: Republicans praised what they characterized as a narrow and well-executed plan, while Democrats expressed alarm, warning that the mission was vaguely defined.

title: The ICE Shooting Came During an Operation Focused on Somali Immigrants
summary: Federal immigration officials have stepped up enforcement activity in Minnesota amid a fraud scandal there that includes many people of Somali origin.

title: Horns, Whistles and Then Gunfire on a Minneapolis Street
summary: A man opened his door to discover a tableau of deadly violence after a federal agent fatally shot a woman.

title: Deadly Minneapolis Encounter Is the 9th ICE Shooting Since September
summary: All those targeted in the shootings were fired on while in their vehicles.

title: Trump Says He Wants Congress to Stop Wall St. From Buying Single-Family Houses
summary: The president said he wanted Congress to stop the purchases by big investors, which have driven up rents and set obstacles for first-time buyers in some markets.

title: Justice Dept. Staff Fear Turmoil Diverts Them From Potential Threats
summary: Rank-and-file prosecutors and agents have expressed serious concern that a hobbled work force hurts the government’s ability to identify and stop terrorist plots, cyberattacks, mass violence and fraud.

title: Most Lawyers in the Manhattan U.S. Attorney’s Office Are on Epstein Duty
summary: The Justice Department has dedicated scores of lawyers, including more than 125 from the Southern District of New York, to reviewing over two million documents in the prominent case.

title: RFK Jr. Overhauls Food Pyramid to Emphasize Red Meat and Dairy
summary: The Trump administration released new dietary guidelines on Wednesday, pushing Americans to prioritize protein and cut back on added sugars and processed foods.

title: New Dietary Guidelines Abandon Longstanding Advice on Alcohol
summary: Now the government’s recommendation is to “limit” drinking, without specifying safe amounts for men and women. The guidelines no longer warn of risks like cancer.

title: New Novels to Read This Year
summary: Tayari Jones, Ann Patchett, George Saunders and Veronica Roth return with new novels; Jennette McCurdy makes her fiction debut; and more.

title: New Nonfiction Books to Read This Year
summary: Memoirs by Sylvester Stallone and the founder of Barstool Sports; essays from celebrated novelists Jesmyn Ward and Jayne Anne Phillips; and more.

title: Abel Ferrara: In Rome, They Call Him ‘Maestro’
summary: Abel Ferrara, an icon of down-and-dirty New York cinema who has a key role in ‘Marty Supreme,’ tells the story of his wild career in a frank memoir.

title: California Tech Executives Plot Against Rep. Ro Khanna Over Support of Wealth Tax
summary: It’s hard right now to be a progressive Democrat in the heart of America’s tech industry.

title: Nick Reiner’s Lawyer, Alan Jackson, Removes Himself From Murder Case
summary: Mr. Reiner, who is charged with killing his parents, will now be represented by a public defender. His arraignment has been rescheduled for next month.

title: As Charlie Kirk’s Turning Point Pushes Into High Schools, Dissension Follows
summary: Since Mr. Kirk’s death, chapters of his organization’s affiliate for teenagers have more than doubled in number, aided by politicians who have said they won’t tolerate opposition.

title: University to Pay $500,000 to Professor It Fired Over Charlie Kirk Post
summary: Austin Peay State University in Tennessee also reinstated Darren Michael, a tenured acting professor whose post about Mr. Kirk’s killing inflamed conservatives.

title: Yemen Separatist Leader Refuses to Attend Talks, Deepening Saudi Arabia-UAE Clash
summary: Invited to Saudi Arabia for talks, dozens of Yemeni separatist officials went incommunicado on Wednesday as the conflict in their country took a sharp twist.

title: Texas A&M Warns Professor Not to Teach Plato Because of Gender Rules
summary: The university is reviewing courses under new rules restricting teaching about race and gender. Administrators told a philosophy professor to cut some lessons on Plato to comply.

title: Can Timothée Chalamet Break This Oscar Curse?
summary: The best actor Oscar almost never goes to young men, though the 30-year-old has his best chance yet with “Marty Supreme.”

title: 2026 SAG Actor Award Nominations List: ‘One Battle’ and ‘Sinners’ Lead
summary: Timothée Chalamet and Ariana Grande also scored nods. Cynthia Erivo and the stars of “Jay Kelly” were left out.

title: Trump’s Voters Are Discovering What ‘America First’ Really Means
summary: Whether or not the Venezuelan raid was advisable, it was Trumpian.

title: What I Saw When I Peeked Over the Edge of Consciousness
summary: Facing death is a core part of making meaning of one’s life. To struggle through this universal contemplation without a community can be brutal.

title: The U.S. Seized Two Oil Tankers
summary: Also, an ICE agent fatally shot a woman in Minneapolis. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.

title: Google and Character.AI to Settle Lawsuit Over Teenager’s Death
summary: The settlement came in the case of a 14-year-old in Florida who had killed himself after developing a relationship with an A.I. chatbot.

title: Julie Menin Is Elected New York City Council Speaker
summary: Ms. Menin, a centrist Democrat, said she would investigate bad actors in business and city agencies and played down areas of difference with Mayor Zohran Mamdani.

title: Philip Yancey, Prominent Christian Author, Admits to Extramarital Affair
summary: He said he would retire from writing and public speaking.
